commitResults.messageBody: Chatbot will simply greet the user and exit.
After the greeting, Steven now echos commands entered by the user, and exits when the user types the command "bye".
Add the ability to store whatever text entered by the user and display them back to the user when requested.
The Task class represents a task that can be marked as done or not done, each task also has a description.

The main chatbot file now uses the Task class when creating new
tasks in the to-do list.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add ability to mark and unmark tasks
commitResults.messageBody: Users can now mark tasks as done with "mark <n>" and unmark them with "unmark <n>", where n refers to the task number in the to-do list.

A ToDo task represents a task without a date or time.
It can be created and added to the to-do list using `todo <description>`.

A Deadline task represents a task that needs to be done before a specific date or time.
It can be created and added to the to-do list using `deadline <description> /by <deadline>`.

An Event task represents a task that start at a specific date/time and ends at a specific date/time.
It can be created and added to the to-do list using `event <description> /from <start> /to end`.
Testing can be done through runtest.sh using inputs from input.txt and comparing it with the expected outputs from EXPECTED.TXT, all of which can be found in /text-ui-test.
Separated out all of the if... else... blocks into their own methods to improve readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add task error handling with println
commitResults.messageBody: Steven is able to handle erroneous inputs for all 3 types of tasks, and the error is handled by printing statements about the error.
Erroneous input for creating new tasks is handled with an EmptyDescriptionException when a user tries to create a todo, deadline, or event task without providing a description.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add exception for invalid task format
commitResults.messageBody: Erroneous input for creating new tasks is handled with an InvalidTaskFormatException when a user tries to create deadline or event task with the wrong format.
Erroneous input for creating new deadline tasks is handled with a MissingDeadlineException when a user tries to create deadline task but does not specify a deadline.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add exception for missing event time
commitResults.messageBody: Erroneous input for creating new event tasks is handled with a MissingStartAndEndTimeException when a user tries to create an event task but does not specify a start and/or end time.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add exception for invalid mark format
commitResults.messageBody: Erroneous input for marking/unmarking tasks is handled with an InvalidMarkFormatException when a user tries to mark/unmark a task but does not specify a task number.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add error handling for invalid mark
commitResults.messageBody: Error of marking or unmarking a list item that does not exist, e.g. `mark 4` when the list only has 3 items, is handled by printing an error message.
